record.field: 1. Market logistic planning has the following four steps. Arrange the steps in correct sequence:

field.name: description

ol.li: Develop operational excellence in sales forecasting, warehouse management transportation and material management
Select the best channel design and network strategy for reaching the customers
Implement the solution with the best information systems, equipment policies and procedures
Decide on companyâ€™s value proposition to its customers

field.h3: Select the correct option from those below

record.field: 2. In the recent years - the major gain in logistical efficiency have come from which one of the following?

ol.li: Increase in production of commercial vehicles

record.field: 3. Given below are two statements. One is labeled as Assertion ( A ) and the other is labeled as Reason ( R ). Assertion ( A ): If the firm is prepared to incur increased cost on transportation, it may be in a position to reduce its inventory cost. Reason ( R ): As in such a case, the firm can use the fastest mode of transport and rush the goods / stocks to the desired warehouse, unmindful of the cost of transportation.

field.name: description
field.h3: In the context of the above two statements related to logistics management, which of the following options is correct

ol.li: Both A) and R) true and R) is the correct explanation of A)
Both A) and R) true but R) is NOT the correct explanation of A)
A) is true but R) is false
A) is false but R) is true

record.field: 4. Which of the following is not a part of the Supply chain Management system?
5. _______ includes design and administration of systems to control the flow of materials, WIP, and finished inventory to support business unit strategy.
6. Which of the following is not a component of 4PL?
7. The permitted free days for the goods to be kept in port for shipment is _____
8. If shipment is not effected within the permitted free days, the goods incur
9. The intermediary who commonly works for imports is
10. Indian companies including ship agents can operate as MTS on obtaining license from
11. The strategic component of logistical mission
A. reflect the vision of top management
B. deal with basic services required for delivering goods
C. refers to the value-added services offered
D. reflects the ability of firm to exploit market
12. The logistical component of logistical mission
A. reflect the vision of top management
B. deal with basic services required for delivering goods
C. refers to the value-added services offered
D. reflects the ability of firm to exploit market
13. A supply chain which includes the distribution of finished product and service?
14. What additional factor does overall equipment effectiveness take into account which makes it more meaningful than efficiency or utilization?
15. Which of the following is true for supply chain management?
A. The physical material moves in the direction of the end of the chain
B. Flow of the cash backward through the chain.
C. Exchange of information moves in both directions.
16. The purpose of supply chain management is _____
B. Improve quality of a product
C. Integrating supply and demand management
17. Logistics is the part of supply chain involved with the forward and reserve flow of _____
C. The customer simply change their minds
19. The supply concept originated in what discipline?
20. Qualified is defined by the customer is _____
A. An unrealistic definition of quality
B. A user based definition of quality
C. A manufacturing based definition of quality
D. A product based definition of quality
21. Which one of the following would not generally be considered as an aspect of operations management?
22. The outcome of limited integrated business function was
C. customer value and harmonious relation
D. increased productivity, profitability and market share

23. The new logistics manager at Safe Freight Group (SFG) has been given the task to improve SFG's planning and control. They have already reviewed SFG's capacity and likely future demand and have created a spreadsheet showing all of the required activities. Their next task is to prioritize the order in which activities should be performed. This is known as _____
24. Forecasting demand is challenging. In business-to-consumer markets, which of the following are most likely to impact demand?
25. The warehousing function that combines the logistical flow of several small shipments to a specific market area is _____
26. According to the Multimodal Transportation of Goods Act, a multimodal transport document cannot be _____
27. Cost efficiency is determined by which of the following drivers?
A. Supply Costs, Experience, Product/Process Design and Economies of Scale
B. Supply Costs & Economies of Scale
C. Product/Process Design and Economies of Scale
28. The value chain attempts to identify those activities which add value to:
B. The senior strategic managers in the organization
D. The customer or final user
29. Distribution requirements planning is a system for _____
30. What are the elements of the logistics system ?
